hypothesis_content.title: Post-Expiry Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a large options expiry event (like the recent $23B BTC expiry), if BTC consolidates within a ±1.5% range for 24-36 hours post-expiry under NEUTRAL regime, a directional breakout in the direction of the initial 1-hour move after the breakout will yield a 2:1 risk/reward over the next 12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Large options expiries remove gamma hedging flows that suppress volatility. Post-expiry consolidation represents a volatility vacuum that is often filled by directional moves as dealers reposition and new catalysts emerge. The initial 1-hour direction post-breakout indicates which side of the order book is dominant.
entry_conditions: BTC trades within ±1.5% range (high-low) for 24-36 hours
Break above/below consolidation range with 1h candle close

exit_conditions.take_profit: 2.5% move from entry in breakout direction
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1.25% move against entry (back into consolidation range)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain direction within 4 hours and returns to consolidation range more than 60% of the time across 20+ instances.
